lines.text: That's not for me. That's not what I want. That's not love, Maddy. Because to me things must last.
A tattoo isn't something you put on or take off just like sunglasses. It's a very important decision.
Have to understand soemthing, Maddy. I've committed my life to you.
It's not crap. Some people need it, makes them feel important, gives them a feeling of confidence, strength. I can't keep this place running just on what I like.
Usually they're women that are ready to identified, ready to belong. Women that need the mark in order to exist. It's nothing new. It's actually been going on for centuries.

Don't you know that I have committed my life to you? That this is a protective shield? It's my mark, Maddy, it's all I have to offer you. Now I'm not sure anymore whether you're worthy of it. I don't even think that I've made the right choice.
But then you mustn't hurt me. Because if I hurt my skin, then you hurt the mark and you don't want to do that.
